page.title: 01LONDON BOROUGH OF HARROW
page.content:
The London Borough of Harrow has about 200,000 inhabitants within its 20 square miles. It is a multi-ethnic community, with a particularly significant number of its citizens being Asian of East African origin. At the present time (July 1985), nearly 25% of the population is from a racial group other than European.
EDGWARE, QUEENSBURY AND STANMORE
The information which follows is concerned with the eastern part of the Borough only. Our D-Block is nevertheless typical of the whole area. It is urban: predominantly residential with a significant amount of light industrial and commercial activity.
